Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The proposed planning activity seeks to establish a new Industry/University Cooperative Research Center (I/UCRC) site at Iowa State University of the existing Center for e-Design. The center currently involves six universities -Virginia Tech as lead, the University of Massachusetts Amherst, the University of Central Florida, Carnegie Mellon University, University of Buffalo, and Brigham Young University. The specific needs within the Center to be met by Iowa State University are focused in the following areas: 1) information technology strategies and optimization of products and systems, 2) design education and training, 3) early stage design theories and methodologies, 4) robotics and sensor integration, 5) materials, manufacturing and design, and 6) design for sustainability.

The proposed new site, in combination with the existing center plans to build innovation capacity by developing methods and tools that support the realization of new virtual simulation and design paradigms for development of new engineered products and systems. The outcomes from the center have the potential to broadly impact the public and private sectors through impact on manufacturing. The site plans to have a significant impact on students via a broad range of mechanism from curriculum to design experiences. The PI and other Iowa State faculty have a documented history of recruiting women and minority graduate and undergraduate students. Research and educational findings will be disseminated nationally and have significant broader impact through industrial collaboration and technology transfer.

Institution.Name: Iowa State University
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: IOWA STATE UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Center for e-Design is a cooperative research center combining industry needs with academic resources to produce more efficient, effective, and collaborative electronic design processes and tools. Many high-tech companies and agencies face engineering challenges that limit the evolution of systems and products. The Center is committed to resolving these challenges through innovative and collaborative research. Center acitivities focus on fundamental research, research test-beds, engineering education, and technology transfer. The Center for e-Design is a National Science Foundation Industry/University Cooperative Research Center.

The e-Design Center has had a long productive tenure beginning with the first established NSF I/UCRC for this Center at the University of Pittsburgh in 2004. Iowa State has become a member of the Center in 2012. With the conclusion of this specific NSF award, the site will continue to serve the area companies while no longer receiving NSF funds. Among the many significant accomplishments of the Iowa State site are: devlopment of significant industrial relations that benefited capstone design programs and increasing indsutrial research as well as translation of e-Design funded research to DMDII and REMADE funded larger research programs.

Overall, the Iowa State site of the Center for e-Design has become a productive means to engage with industrial companies to collaboratively approach contemporary design and manufacturing problems. Given the industrial transformation towards smart manufacturing and design technologies, the site will continue its orginal mission while being connected to the Center for e-Design.  

 


Last Modified: 01/09/2020
Modified by: Gul E Okudan Kremer
POR.POR_COPY_TXT: The Center for e-Design is a cooperative research center combining industry needs with academic resources to produce more efficient, effective, and collaborative electronic design processes and tools. Many high-tech companies and agencies face engineering challenges that limit the evolution of systems and products. The Center is committed to resolving these challenges through innovative and collaborative research. Center acitivities focus on fundamental research, research test-beds, engineering education, and technology transfer. The Center for e-Design is a National Science Foundation Industry/University Cooperative Research Center. The e-Design Center has had a long productive tenure beginning with the first established NSF I/UCRC for this Center at the University of Pittsburgh in 2004. Iowa State has become a member of the Center in 2012. With the conclusion of this specific NSF award, the site will continue to serve the area companies while no longer receiving NSF funds. Among the many significant accomplishments of the Iowa State site are: devlopment of significant industrial relations that benefited capstone design programs and increasing indsutrial research as well as translation of e-Design funded research to DMDII and REMADE funded larger research programs. Overall, the Iowa State site of the Center for e-Design has become a productive means to engage with industrial companies to collaboratively approach contemporary design and manufacturing problems. Given the industrial transformation towards smart manufacturing and design technologies, the site will continue its orginal mission while being connected to the Center for e-Design.
